docs.snippet: Effective immediately, any player in England’s top soccer league who has a “confirmed or suspected period of loss of consciousness” on the field must be removed from the game.
docs.lead_paragraph: Effective immediately, any player in England’s top soccer league who has a “confirmed or suspected period of loss of consciousness” on the field must be removed from the game.
docs.abstract: England's Premier League mandates that only team’s doctor can determine whether player is fit to continue after losing consciousness from head injury; adds that any player even thought to have lost consciousness will be removed from the game and forbidden to return.

headline.main: Premier League’s New Concussion Protocol Empowers On-Field Doctors
headline.print_headline: Premier League’s New Concussion Protocol Empowers On-Field Doctors

docs.snippet: The world players' union FIFPro called for Luis Suarez's ban for biting to be reduced on Friday as the Uruguay and Barcelona forward’s appeal was heard at the Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS).
docs.lead_paragraph: The world players' union FIFPro called for Luis Suarez's ban for biting to be reduced on Friday as the Uruguay and Barcelona forward’s appeal was heard at the Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS).

headline.main: FIFPro Calls for Suarez Ban Reduction as Appeal Takes Place
headline.print_headline: FIFPro Calls for Suarez Ban Reduction as Appeal Takes Place

docs.snippet: Luis Suarez's appeal of his FIFA ban for biting an opponent at the World Cup will be decided next week.
docs.lead_paragraph: Luis Suarez's appeal of his FIFA ban for biting an opponent at the World Cup will be decided next week.

headline.main: Suarez Appeals FIFA Ban, Bite Verdict Next Week
headline.print_headline: Suarez Appeals FIFA Ban, Bite Verdict Next Week

docs.snippet: Paris St Germain's Zlatan Ibrahimovic struck twice and missed a penalty in an enthralling 2-2 draw at Stade de Reims as the French champions avoided an embarrassing defeat when the Ligue 1 season got underway on Friday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Paris St Germain's Zlatan Ibrahimovic struck twice and missed a penalty in an enthralling 2-2 draw at Stade de Reims as the French champions avoided an embarrassing defeat when the Ligue 1 season got underway on Friday.

headline.main: Ibrahimovic Double Earns PSG Draw 2-2 at Reims
headline.print_headline: Ibrahimovic Double Earns PSG Draw 2-2 at Reims

docs.snippet: Readers respond to a letter by Peggy Deamer, an architect, calling for less arrogance and more collaboration in architecture.
docs.lead_paragraph: Readers respond to a letter by Peggy Deamer, an architect, calling for less arrogance and more collaboration in architecture.

docs.snippet: Never one to shy away from taking a calculated risk, Canadian prop Jason Marshall is hoping his latest gamble will reap both short-term benefits at next year's rugby World Cup and usher in long-term gains for his compatriots.
docs.lead_paragraph: Never one to shy away from taking a calculated risk, Canadian prop Jason Marshall is hoping his latest gamble will reap both short-term benefits at next year's rugby World Cup and usher in long-term gains for his compatriots.

headline.main: Risk-Taking Marshall Set for New Zealand Gamble
headline.print_headline: Risk-Taking Marshall Set for New Zealand Gamble

docs.snippet: Losing the fight against same-sex marriage at home, leading U.S. Evangelical Christians are joining in the culture wars in Latin America as cheerleaders for opponents of gay legal partnerships, abortion and pornography.
docs.lead_paragraph: Losing the fight against same-sex marriage at home, leading U.S. Evangelical Christians are joining in the culture wars in Latin America as cheerleaders for opponents of gay legal partnerships, abortion and pornography.

headline.main: U.S. Evangelicals Cheer on Latin American Culture Wars
headline.print_headline: U.S. Evangelicals Cheer on Latin American Culture Wars

docs.snippet: Former Germany international striker Cacau has agreed a deal with Cerezo Osaka and will link up with Uruguay forward Diego Forlan at the Japanese strugglers upon passing a medical.
docs.lead_paragraph: Former Germany international striker Cacau has agreed a deal with Cerezo Osaka and will link up with Uruguay forward Diego Forlan at the Japanese strugglers upon passing a medical.

headline.main: Cerezo Osaka Sign Former Germany Striker Cacau
headline.print_headline: Cerezo Osaka Sign Former Germany Striker Cacau

docs.snippet: Liverpool's players oozed confidence in the post-Luis Suarez era as they began their final countdown to the start of the Premier League season.

docs.snippet: Roy Hodgson suffered "dark moments" but did not think of resigning as England manager following his team's disappointing group-stage exit at this year's World Cup in Brazil.
docs.lead_paragraph: Roy Hodgson suffered "dark moments" but did not think of resigning as England manager following his team's disappointing group-stage exit at this year's World Cup in Brazil.

headline.main: England's Hodgson Had 'Dark Moments', Never Considered Quitting
